page.title: 07Education in Horsmonden
page.content: Children who live in Horsmonden go to Horsmonden School from the age of five until they are eleven. Some choose to go to Brenchley, Goudhurst or private schools. The school day begins at nine a.m. and ends at three-fifteen. There is a break for lunch from twelve ten to one-twenty. School meals are served for sixty pence each but many children bring their own sandwiches. The school has four classes and as well as Maths, English and Topic work the children learn swimming and music. Out of school activities include lessons in playing recorders, clarinet, guitar, infants and junior gymnastics, football, netball, rounders, swimming and the Wildlife Club. At the age of eleven most of the children go to Mascalls Comprehensive School in Paddock Wood but some choose to sit for selection and try for Grammar Schools
